TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit InheritableProperty`1<TValueType> extends System.Object
generic <typename TValueType> public ref class InheritableProperty abstract

Docs.typeparam: Base type of the inheritable property. Examples include values such as and .
Docs.summary: Base class for inheritable properties on the class.

remarks.para: Used to simulate inheritable properties on instances of objects. For example, CustomMasterUrl is not a derived property on an SPWeb object. However, the CustomMasterUrl property on a PublishingWeb is a derived property. The InheritableProperty`1 class adds support that pushes properties down to subwebs that are set to inherit the parent Web property. This class also allows the hierarchy below a current Web to be reset.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetInherit (bool inherit, bool forceAllSubWebInherit);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetInherit(bool inherit, bool forceAllSubWebInherit) cil managed
Public Function SetInherit (inherit As Boolean, forceAllSubWebInherit As Boolean) As LongRunningOperationJob
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Internal::LongRunningOperationJob ^ SetInherit(bool inherit, bool forceAllSubWebInherit);

Docs.param: Forces all subsites to inherit this value, even if the property on a subsite currently does not inherit.
Docs.summary: Sets the flag to indicate whether this property inherits its value from its parent site.
Docs.returns: A flag indicating whether this property inherits its value from its parent site.

remarks.para: This method sets the inheritance of a object. The current user must have permissions to set the inheritance value for the current PublishingWeb object. If there are child PublishingWeb objects set to inherit, they are updated with the new values regardless of whether the current user has permissions to modify the child PublishingWeb objects.

If forceAllSubWebInherit is set to True, the current user must have permissions to modify any child PublishingWeb objects that are marked as inheriting. When breaking inheritance, the currently inherited value is kept.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetValue (TValueType value);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetValue(!TValueType value) cil managed
Public Function SetValue (value As TValueType) As LongRunningOperationJob
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Internal::LongRunningOperationJob ^ SetValue(TValueType value);

Docs.param: The property value set by this method.
Docs.summary: Sets the value of this property.

remarks.para: This method sets the value of the property on the current object. If there are child PublishingWeb objects set to inherit, all changes are propagated to the child PublishingWeb objects. The current user must have permissions to modify the parent PublishingWeb object, but does not need permissions to modify child PublishingWeb objects that are marked as inheriting. This operation may be asynchronous if subsites exist under the current site.

MemberSignature.Value: public Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetValue (TValueType value, bool forceAllSubWebInherit);
.method public hidebysig instance class Microsoft.SharePoint.Publishing.Internal.LongRunningOperationJob SetValue(!TValueType value, bool forceAllSubWebInherit) cil managed
Public Function SetValue (value As TValueType, forceAllSubWebInherit As Boolean) As LongRunningOperationJob
public: Microsoft::SharePoint::Publishing::Internal::LongRunningOperationJob ^ SetValue(TValueType value, bool forceAllSubWebInherit);

Docs.param: The property value set by this method.
Forces all subsites to inherit this value, even if the property on a subsite currently does not inherit.

remarks.para: This method sets the value of the current object, and forces all child PublishingWeb objects to inherit the new value if the forceAllSubWebInherit parameter is set to True. If the forceAllSubWebInherit parameter is set to TRUE, the user must have permissions to modify any child PublishingWeb objects that are marked as inheriting. This operation may be asynchronous if there subsites exist under the current site.
